TextEng: Neither, thanks. Goodbye.
I would like to ask you some questions.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - lie]</Start> Have you heard about the new kobold defense tax?
Text: <StartCheck>[설득 - 거짓말]</Start> 새로운 코볼트 방어세에 대해 들었어요?

TextEng: Did you have problems with the kobolds?
That is all my questions.
No, thanks. Goodbye.
Would you tell me about yourself?
Please stop fooling around. I was trying to be serious.
Text: 장난 좀 그만해요. 진지하게 얘기하려는 거였어요.

TextEng: Yes, you are about the most annoying person I have ever met.
Text: 그래요, 당신은 내가 만난 사람 중에 제일 짜증나요.

TextEng: No. I think you are pretty normal.
What I meant to say, is you are fat, ugly and completely out of your mind.
Text: 내가 말하려던 건, 당신이 뚱뚱하고 못생기고 완전히 제정신이 아니라는 거예요.

TextEng: Fine, then I'll just see your inventory and then I'll go.
Is this another joke?
I'm sorry.
Yes, but I like you all the same.
Fine, I didn't really want to hear it anyways.
I will respect your privacy.
Why?
What was so bad for you?
Piper said he sold you his sword.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - lie]</Start> That is not the story he tells. He says you stole it from him!
Text: <StartCheck>[설득 - 거짓말]</Start> 그 사람은 다르게 말하던데요. 당신이 훔쳐갔다고요!

TextEng: I want to buy it.
Could I have it?
I found these magical antlers. Do you know anything about them?
Text: 이 마법의 뿔을 찾았는데요. 뭔지 알아요?

TextEng: Neither, goodbye.
I will sell them to you.
Maybe I would like the helm, after all.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> For such powerful items, you could certainly spare more than that.
Text: <StartCheck>[설득]</Start> 이렇게 강력한 물건인데, 좀 더 주실 수 있잖아요.

TextEng: Never mind.
No, I want the helm.
I will take it.
I will take it.
I want the helm.
I changed my mind. How much will you buy them for?
That is too much.
<StartAction>[Cast Charm]</Start> You would like to do this for much less.
Never mind, goodbye.
Here is the gold.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Intimidate]</Start> I think allowing you to live should give me a nice discount.
Text: <StartCheck>[설득 - 위협]</Start> 살려두는 대가로 할인해주는 게 좋을 것 같은데요.

TextEng: <StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Couldn't you help an old friend out? I have always felt so close to you.
Text: <StartCheck>[설득]</Start> 옛 친구 좀 도와줄 수 없어요? 항상 가깝게 느꼈는데.

TextEng: I will pay.
I would like to see your goods.
Goodbye.
I met a half-orc named Glendir, who claims to be your brother.
He's doing well; if you count being a prisoner of hungry gnolls as a good thing.
Text: 잘 지내요. 배고픈 놀들의 포로인 게 좋은 거라면요.

TextEng: I imagine he will be dead soon.
He is being held by a group of gnolls.
I imagine the gnolls will devour him soon.
Text: 놀들이 곧 그를 잡아먹을 것 같아요.

TextEng: He is a prisoner of a group of gnolls.
I am not going to save him.
I will only rescue him if I am getting paid.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Your brother's life must be worth something to you?
I am working on it.
I have news for you. Your brother, Glendir, is dead.
Text: 소식 전할 게 있어요. 남동생 글렌디르가 죽었어요.

TextEng: Not a chance! You gambled and you lost.
Text: 절대 안 돼요! 도박에서 진 거예요.

TextEng: No, I already spent it.
Fine, goodbye.
Then you are of no more use to me. I think I will enjoy killing you.
Text: 그럼 이제 쓸모없군요. 죽이는 걸 즐기겠어요.

TextEng: Of course. I am sorry, Fiona.
I would like to see your goods.
Not yet.
I have this promissory note.
Goodbye.
<StartCheck>[Persuade - Intimidate]</Start> I'll be getting something from you, if you know what is good for you!
Text: <StartCheck>[설득 - 위협]</Start> 뭐 좀 받아야겠어요, 당신 잘되려면요!

TextEng: <StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You could give me some equipment instead of the gold.
Text: <StartCheck>[설득]</Start> 금화 대신 장비를 줄 수도 있잖아요.

TextEng: I want a reward.
Fine. Goodbye.
What does that mean?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I deserve something for my efforts.
Text: <StartCheck>[설득]</Start> 제 노력에 대한 대가를 받을 자격이 있어요.

TextEng: How is Glendir, a half-orc, your brother?
What are you talking about?
